posts.title: Land of the Unknown: A History of Hart Island
posts.text: Hart Island has primarily been a "potter's field" where New York City's unclaimed, deceased are buried. But the sad history of the small island is only part of the story.

posts.title: Frank E. Campbell: Undertaker to the Stars
posts.text: Campbell’s funeral home business pioneered the over-the-top celebrity burial and his list of clients reads like a Who’s Who of Hollywood stars. With a fleet of Rolls Royces and a private yacht, last rites at Campbell’s allowed one to truly “go out in style.”

posts.title: Nature Walk through History: Ten Famous Trees of NYC
posts.text: Some are still standing and some live on only in memory.
